title: Farming of Cervid Livestock: A Look into Management of the Animal and its Waste

tasks.task: Analyze the management and feeding of cervid livestock to determine manure characteristics
subtasks: Identify different cervid species (whitetail deer, elk, fallow deer, red deer)
Understand varying management methods for cervid farms (extensive vs. intensive, sporting vs. breeding)
Determine typical feed intake for cervid species (5% body weight dry matter)
Calculate digestibility rates (50% forage digestibility, 1.6% crude protein in red deer vs. 1% in whitetail)
Compare manure dry matter content and implications for handling and application

tasks.task: Analyze the manure characteristics of cervid livestock based on species and management practices.
subtasks: Identify the different cervid species (red deer, whitetail deer) and their respective feed intake percentages (5% vs. 0.8% of body weight).
Calculate the daily dry matter intake for each species based on body weight.
Determine the digestibility rate (50%) and apply it calculate the dry matter excreted in the manure.
Estimate the crude protein content in the manure (1.6% for red deer, 1% for whitetail).
Compare the results and discuss the implications for manure management (e.g., confined vs. pasture-based operations).

tasks.task: Analyze the manure characteristics of cervid livestock based on species and management practices.
subtasks: Identify the different cervid species and their feed intake percentages.
Calculate daily dry matter intake for each species.
Determine digestibility impact on manure dry matter.
Estimate crude protein content in manure.
Compare results and discuss implications for manure management.

tasks.task: Analyze the manure characteristics of cervid livestock based on species and management practices.
Analyze the digestive processes and resultant manure characteristics of cervid livestock.
** MAINTASK: Analyze the manure characteristics of cervid livestock based on feeding and digestive data.
subtasks: Identify the zoo species (e.g., red deer, whitetail).
Calculate feed intake rates (5% vs. 0.8% body weight).
Calculate digestibility (50%) and fecal dry matter.
Estimate crude protein and nitrogen content in manure.
Discuss how management practices (extensive vs. intensive) impact manure handling.
